messageBody:
I'd love to see:

- discussion of common class loader problems
- techniques for writing test case stubs: automatic
generation, what to put in them (e.g comments,
expiring assertion pattern, ...)
- integrating with a daily build/BVT (i.e.
CruiseControl)
- augmenting with other test tools (like JProbe
Coverage)
- going beyond unit testing (we use it for "POST"
tests - production verification tests - and I'm
working on a non-invasive, lightweight suite for
continous, proactive probing of a production system)


--- Mike Duffy <mduffy_lists@...> wrote:
> I have only been using JUnit for a few months and I
> am focusing on
> creating "best practices" templates for our
> development team.
>
> I would greatly appreciate the insight of more
> experienced users.
>
> If you have ideas for "Best Practices" that you
> think would be
> beneficial to the users of JUnit, please reply to
> this email with the
> topic.
>
> If you would like to start a thread on a specific
> best practice,
> please use the following format for the subject of
> the message:
>
> [junit] Best Practices [Topic]
>
> I'll volunteer to create summaries for the more
> popular topics.
>
>
//========================================================
> // Suggested Topics for JUnit Best Practices
>
//========================================================
> //
> // What basic principles should I follow in creating
> tests?
> // [basic principles]
> //
> // How do I implement a test case for a thrown
> exception?
> // [thrown exception]
> //
> // Do I catch or throw exceptions when testing a
> method?
> // [catch or throw]
> //
> // What naming conventions should I use for test
> classes
> // and test methods?
> // [naming conventions]
> //
> // How do I organize my Test Cases?
> // [organize test cases]
> //
> // What is the best way to integrate JUnit with Ant?
> // [integrate with Ant]
>
//========================================================
